message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.DS 

This paper deals with the optimization of radio network deployment and coverage, which is a key issue in the field of wireless networks. The paper discusses the decision of whether to install additional small cells or to upgrade current macrocell base stations with massive antenna arrays. This problem is related to network optimization, network planning, and network design, which are all subcategories of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also considers capacity limits of both the radio access link and the backhaul link, which are related to information theory and communication theory, respectively, and thus, the paper may also belong to cs.IT (Information Theory). The paper proposes a novel deployment algorithm that uses Lagrangian relaxation and tabu local search, which are optimization techniques that are commonly used in machine learning and optimization, and thus, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper deals with an integrated deployment problem, which involves multiple components and subsystems, and thus, the paper may also belong to cs.SY (Systems and Control).
